shortdescription: STRENGTHTENING OF ENVIRONMENTAL ADMINISTRATION IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Strengthtening of Environmental Administration in Nepal
longdescription: The project aims to strengthen environmental administration and management at the local level in order to protect, enhance, sustain and monitor the environment, and also provide healthier and ecologically more diverse living environments for the population in the area, as well as enhance occupational health concerns and build the capacity at the local level. The goal is to build and integrate a local level environmental administration and management model to monitor the environment in Nepal.

shortdescription: RURAL VILLAGE WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT PROJECT, SECOND PHASE
projecttitle: Rural Village Water Resources Management Project, Second Phase
purposename: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
longdescription: The overall objective of RVWRMP is institutionalised capacity at local and regional levels to sustain and continuously improve enhanced quality of life, better environmental conditions and increased opportunities in rural livelihoods in the project area. The purpose of the phase II is to achieve improved well-being and reduced poverty in project VDCs. The new phase emphasises the impacts of the project instead of means.

shortdescription: SUPPORT TO CONSTITUTION BUILDING IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Support to Constitution building in Nepal
channelreportedname: International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (IDEA)
longdescription: The project is to be implemented within the International IDEA ongoing project Supporting Constitution Building in Nepal by including additional outcomes and activities. The objectives are to 1) build capacity of key political actors involved in Nepal's constitution making process, and 2) initiate and deepen dialogue among key political actors towards building consensus on these constitutional issues.

Strategic Framework and Operational Plan 2009-2013, AfP. The Embassy of Finland has signed a Memorandum of Understanding among Alliance for Peace and its Strategic Partners (Danida Hugou and MS Nepal)to enter into a Strategic Parnership for next three years. The total cost of the five year programme is approximately NPR 89 million or about 890 000 Euros.The overall objective of the Strategic Partnership mechanism is to forge stronger donor alignment with civil society goals and objectives, and enhanced harmonization of support to CSO partners in Nepal with a view to improving aid effectiveness and reduce transaction costs.Alliance for Peace five year strategic framework and operational plan has been divided into five thematical areas:1. Internal democratization of political students and youth wings 2. Human rights and transitional justice 3. Peace building and conflict transformation 4. Youth engagement and outreach in constitution building 5. Strengthening AfP Nepal, partner organizations and youth peace dialogue centres.

shortdescription: RURAL VILLAGE WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT PROJECT IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Rural village water resources management project in Nepal
longdescription: Improve quality of life, environmental conditions and increase opportunities to improve rural livelihoods in the Mid- and Far West regions through rational, equitable and sustainable use of water at the village level.

shortdescription: INCREASED CAPACITY OF HYDROMETEOROLOGICAL SERVICES ICI-PROJECT
projecttitle: Increased Capacity of Hydrometeorological Services ICI-project
longdescription: Finnish Meteorological Institute and the Department of Hydrlogy and Meteorology under the Ministry of Environment have together proposed a ICI-project for Increased Capacity of Hydrometeorological Services in Nepal. The project aims to improve the capacity of DHM in hydrometeorological observations, services and international data sharing and thus improve the capability of the Government of Nepal to respond to the increased risks of natural disasters related to weather and climate.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / SUPPORTING DEMOCRACY THROUGH INVESTIGATIVE JOURNALISM
projecttitle: NGO Support / Supporting Democracy through Investigative Journalism
purposename: Media and free flow of information
longdescription: The development problem the project seeks to address is the need for well-researched, in-depth reports for increasing the quality of the depate for supporting democratisation, peace building and governance in Nepal. Nepal began it's peace process in November 2006 and it is believed that the media can play a major role in moderating expectations through fact-based research and therefore contribute positively in the transformation processes.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / BILINGUAL LITERACY PROJECT IN LHOMI AND NEPALI
projecttitle: NGO Support / Bilingual Literacy Project in Lhomi and Nepali
purposename: Basic life skills for youth & adults
longdescription: The objective of this project is to increase the number of functional literate children and adults in both Lhomi and Nepali and create enough credibility from the local community to develop projects in the area of health, education, IGAs and advocacy.This will be done through organizing literacy classes in close cooperation with local village committees.

shortdescription: REGIONAL SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROJECT IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Regional Solid Waste Management Project in Nepal
longdescription: The purpose of the project is to establish a sustainable, regional solid waste management system in the area of Sunsari and Morang districts in Nepal. This is achieved through an institutionalised cooperation between the municipalities of the two districts providing services also to the surrounding VDCs.

shortdescription: UNWOMEN SUPPORT FOR WOMEN IN SUFFERED IN CONFLICT IN NEPAL
projecttitle: UNWomen support for women in suffered in conflict in Nepal
channelname: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women
longdescription: UN Women will support coherence and coordination across the UN system in advancing women's participation in conflict resolution. UN Women will support existing and new efforts to improve the protection environment for women during and after conflict, to engage women in conflict prevention, and to ensure peacebuilding processes are guided by womens perspectives and address their needs. Promotion of equality, including gender equality, and womens and girls rights are explicitly mentioned in the Finnish Development Policy.

shortdescription: ENVIRONMENT ADMINISTRATION STRENGTHENING IN LOCAL LEVEL SEAM
projecttitle: Environment administration strengthening in local level SEAM
longdescription: The project aims to strengthen environmental administration and management at the local level in the industrial corridor of Nepal. By means of environmental advocacy and the project support local population is sensitized to actively pursue for imporovements  in their sanitary and hygienic conditions. The overall aim of the project is to introduce good practices for environment management systems and pollution control.

channelname: UNITED NATIONS AGENCIES, FUNDS AND COMMISSIONS
longdescription: Support to UNDPA Nepal Office

geography: Nepal, District of Dadeldhura, Villages: Ajayameru, Samaiji, Masthamandu, Ganeshpur
longdescription: The objective of the project is to improve the quality of education and to improve access to educational facilities of primary schools in Far Western Dadeldhura District, Nepal. At school and community level beneficiaries are trained and sensitised, and school facilities improved. At district level, education sector stakeholders are sensitised and trained; special focus is on the governmental bodies. Expeced results are improved enrolment and quality of education, and improved management of the educational bodies.

shortdescription: STRENGTHENING RIGHTS AND SAFETY IN FORESTRY
projecttitle: Strengthening rights and safety in forestry
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Maailman Luonnon Sti, WWF Suomi
geography: Nepal: Kailali, Bardiya, Chitwan, Makwanpur, Bara, Nawalparasi, Rasuwa, Kavre and Sindhupalchok Dist
longdescription: The project aims at strengthening rights and safety of forest trade union members and individual wood workers, and improve the ecological values of the forests in Nepal by educating wood workers on sustainable forest management and biodiversity protection. Increased memberships of forest trade unions and safe working conditions is also an objective. Capacity of government agencies and trade unions to advocate for policies is increased to support sustainable forestry to address climate change.

shortdescription: SANITATION AND WATER FOR ALL IN THE CONTEXT OF CLIMATE CHANGE IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Sanitation and Water for all in the context of Climate Change in Nepal
longdescription: The UNICEF WASH-programme supports the Government of Nepal in its efforts to formulate and implement one national WASH program to achieve the national target of universal water supply and sanitation coverage  by 2017. The programme is implemented throug five components: 1)Support for capacity-building and formulation of a national WASH programme, 2) District level coordination and harmonisation and support for WASH programme interventions, 3) improved interagency coordination on WASH emergency preparedness and response, 4)Rollout of a comprehensive hygiene promotion initiative in selected diarrhoea-prone districts, 5): Scale-up of school WASH, hygiene promotion (including hand washing with soap) and community approaches to total sanitation (CATS), using children as agents of change.

shortdescription: FNBES SUPPORT SERVICES FOR EDUCATION SECTOR COOPERATION IN NEPAL
projecttitle: FNBEs Support Services for Education Sector Cooperation in Nepal
longdescription: The main purpose is to provide support in planning, follow-up and analysis to the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in relation to the development of education sector (especially TEVT) in Nepal. Part of the assignment is to assist in planning and follow-up of the implementation of the SSRP and to participate in the joint meetings and reviews.

shortdescription: SUPPORT TO NEPAL'S SCHOOL SECTOR REFORM PROGRAMME
projecttitle: Support to Nepal's School Sector Reform Programme
longdescription: The GoN has requested the Development Partners to support the education sector through the School Sector Reform (SSR) Program. The overall objective of the SSR is to contribute towards poverty reduction through inclusive, responsive and accountable local governance and participatory community-led development. The Program Development objective is to increase access to and quality of school education especially for children from marginalized groups.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / PROMOTING CHILD RIGHTS THROUGH EDUCATIONAL SETTINGS
projecttitle: NGO Support / Promoting Child Rights Through Educational Settings
longdescription: The school enrolment ratio of children in Nepal is almost 87 percent, but still the drop out rate is also very high, almost 100 children enrolled in grade one only 22 percent appear the school leaving examination. Children experienced discrimination, have suffered violence on the name of discipline, are victims of political conflict and have suffered sexual abuse. The school curriculum is not childrens right responsive and friendly. The project aims to promote and protect child rights in and through educational settings and policies with the active involvement of parents, community and children themselves. The project promotes significantly schools and other educational sectors role on promoting childrens rights at local and national level and to ensure child rights in schools benefits children directly.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / IMPROVIN SEXUAL AND REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH
projecttitle: NGO Support / Improvin sexual and reproductive health
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Suomen lasten ja nuorten sti ry
geography: Nepal, Kathmandu Valley; Lalitpur, Bhaktapur, Kavre, Sindhupalchowk
longdescription: The project builds on the previous efforts of improving sexual and reproductive health of young people.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / INTEGRATED RIVER BASIN MANAGEMENT AT KOSHI RIVER
projecttitle: NGO Support / Integrated river basin management at Koshi River
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Maailman Luonnon Sti WWF Finland
geography: Nepal, Koshi River Basin (eastern Nepal), Indrawati sub-basin
longdescription: The trans-boundary Koshi basin provides freshwater for livelihoods and ecosystem services for millions of poor people in Nepal and India. Due to the pressure from anthropogenic sources and climate change the stability of the system is under threat. The project purpose is to ensure pro-poor sustainable socio-economic and environmental development in Koshi basin based on the principles of Intergrated River Basin Management. The objective is to reduce vulnerability of people, biodiversity, and economic investments in the Koshi River basin caused by climate change and human activities.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / LIVELYHOOD AND ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS PROJECT
projecttitle: NGO Support / Livelyhood and Environmental Awareness Project
longdescription: The project aims to strengthen women's position in decision-making and will improve sanitation and health by building the eco toilets and giving the health guidance. Project includes the education of the local people of constructing the eco toilets and in service training for the local health advisors. Income generating activities are included to enhance the willingness to participate.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / STRENGTHENING THE CAPACITY OF NEPAL SCOUTS
projecttitle: NGO Support / Strengthening the capacity of Nepal Scouts
purposename: Basic life skills for youth & adults
longdescription: Strengthening the capacity of Nepal Scouts.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / GPHRC HOSPITAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
projecttitle: NGO Support / GPHRC hospital development project
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Suomen kristillinen lkriseura ry
longdescription: To keep and provide quality of services to larger number of disabled people needing rehabilitation and medical services in western part of Nepal.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / EQUAL EDUCATION FOR ALL FOND
projecttitle: NGO Support / Equal Education for All Fond
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Finlands Svenska adventkyrka ry
longdescription: Sponsoring a child by financing the education of children from underprivileged families.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / REDUCING POVERTY IN NEPAL, THROUGH INNOVATIVE AND EQUITABLE CARBON FIN
projecttitle: NGO Support / Reducing poverty in Nepal, through innovative and equitable carbon fin
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Maailman Luonnon Sti WWF Finland
longdescription: Aim: To establish functional and equitable carbon financing programme in place based on avoided deforestation and forest degradation (REDD+) for climate change mitigation; enhance knowledge and scientific basis on forest carbon; strengthen the capacity of the government and local communities on REDD mechanisms. Activities: Research, forest and carbon inventories; establish database on carbon stock; awareness raising and training.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / PARTICIPATORY DEVELOPMENT OF LIVELIHOODS, NATURAL RESOURCE MANGEMENT A
projecttitle: NGO Support / Participatory development of livelihoods, natural resource mangement a
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Maailman Luonnon Sti WWF Finland
geography: Nepal; districts of Kanchanpur, Kailai Bardia, Banke, Dang, Chitwan, Parsa and Bara
longdescription: Aims: To prevent forest fragmentation and degradation in Terai area in Nepal; to enhance forest rehabilitation and increase wildlife in forest corridors; to enhance local livelihood and reduce vulnerability of marginalized communities; to empower local community forest user groups, buffer zone forest user groups and community-based anti-poaching groups; to increase knowledge and awareness of the effects of climate change. Activities: Studies, inventories and monitoring of forest resources and socio-economic changes; training and awareness raising of local community-based organizations about  the sustainable use of forest resources, income generating activities, micro-credits etc; training of community-based anti-poaching groups; capacity building of CBOs; preparation of forest and grassland management plans  for CBOs.

shortdescription: TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR LEASEHOLD FOREST AND LIVESTOCK DEVELOPMENT
projecttitle: Technical Assistance for Leasehold Forest and Livestock Development
longdescription: Technical Assistance programme to be implemented through a partnership between IFAD and FAO, is proposed. The main objective is to improve the effectiveness of LFLP and support the implementation, institutionalization and scaling up of the poverty reducing leasehold forestry programme in the country. The key activities include: integration of leasehold forestry and livestock development for poverty alleviation; consolidation and improvement of the extension strategies; follow-up the findings of the studies carried out by the ongoing IFAD supported LFLP and FAO supported TCP Project: institutional framework for a greater contribution of forests and trees to poverty reduction; institutionalization of the and livestock development for poverty alleviation and environmental conservation; establishment and promotion of a goat breeding centre.

There is a need for strengthening of the forestry sector information systems, to enable the realistic preparation of new Master plan and to monitor effectively the impact of recent forest activities after conflict period. The use of TA aim to strengthen the procedures needed for the capture and processing of the National level statistics and support district level forest decision making as well dissemination of information. The overall objective is to strengthen national forest policy level decisions.

shortdescription: FRAME AGREEMENT WITH NGO (FINN CHURCH AID)

purposename: Multisector aid for basic soc. serv.
longdescription: Nepal Development Programme . To organize and empower focus groups to enjoy their rights to land, food, water and other resources including services from the state.

Empowering Partners for Social Responsibility. The project aims to increase the capacity of a local partner to do holistic development work in local communities. Nepal is one of the poorest countries in the world, where majority of the people live in rural areas. Fida s partner in Nepal is the Assemblies of God church (AOG). The project provides training and awareness-raising for the partner on a great variety of issues related to development work. Fida and AOG work together in the local communities and through this hands-on development work the partner acquires practical skills. The project focuses on three major components: Literacy, Community Health Education (CHE) and HIV/AIDS. As AOG s skills and knowledge grow, the partner will become increasingly capable of doing effective community development work of its own. This will contribute to the increasing impact of the partner s work at community level.

Maithili Empowerment Programme. The programme seeks to increase a local partner s capacity to respond to the needs of the Maithili minority in Southern Nepal. The 2.5 million Maithili of Southern Nepal make up the country s largest ethnic minority. Formerly known for their rich culture and traditions, the Maithili now live in poverty and have almost lost their unique identity. To address the needs of the Maithili, Fida partners with a local NGO called Relative Nepal, which belongs to the Assemblies of God Nepal (AGN) church. The programme offers the partner hands-on training in community development work. The main approach used is that of Community Health Education. The work carried out among the Maithili communities includes e.g. literacy training, basic education and cultural revitalization activities. Through the trainings and practical development work conducted during the programme, the partner s capacities build up and, at the same time, the needs of the Maithili communities are addressed. Already one school has been established and children s literacy classes started. These together will contribute towards the improvement of the quality of life in the Maithili communities.

purposename: Basic life skills for youth & adults
longdescription: Youth Centre in Kathmandu. The project seeks to empower a local partner for youth work of its own. Now, after the civil war, the capital of Kathmandu is facing a huge wave of immigration from the rural areas to the city. The young generation in particular is moving into the city in search for work, but lacks sufficient skills and training. Fida partners with the Assemblies of God church (AOG) to address the needs of the youth. Fida and its partner will establish a youth centre in the capital that provides vocational training and counselling to the youth, and facilities for leisure time activities. The AOG church youth will act as volunteers at the centre. Through the youth centre the partner will learn to work with the youth in practice. The youth, in turn, will have their educational and other needs addressed. All in all, the project will improve the life skills of the youth.
Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.), Projects that need further information by the NGO.

geography: Basauti, Gadaria, Pabera, Pahalmanpur, Urma (all in Kailali district, Far West)
longdescription: Water and Sanitation Project WATSAN. The project purpose is the decreased incidence of intestinal deceases in rural communities in target VDCs in Kailali District, Far West, Nepal. Fida's partner, the New Life Service Association (NSA), will have project activities like awareness raising and capacity building of communities on health, sanitation and hygiene and water supply and toilet construction. It will use community mobilization and work in close coordination with partner agencies. The project will form Health and Sanitation groups (called WASH groups) in each VDC to address the root causes (contaminated water, poor sanitation and personal hygiene practices) of the main problem, high incidence of the intestinal diseases.

projecttitle: CIVIL SOCIETY FUND - Governence - Support to Irish based NGOS - CSF Dev Assist. BLOCK - Women's Participation & Rights Realisation-Legal and judicial development1GOV-Governance-GEN-Gender
longdescription: Irish Aid acknowledges the role that Irish civil society organisations can play in building public support for Ireland s aid programme, informing the Irish public through development education programmes, as well as raising awareness of the issues around development assistance. Irish Aid is committed to continuing to support civil society organisations as partners in the attainment of the Millennium Declaration and associated goals for poverty reduction, and in the protection and promotion of human rights.There are seven key objectives that the Civil Society Fund seeks to promote, which coincide with the role of civil society in development cooperation and human rights promotion, and reflect the commitments of the Millennium Development Goals. The Civil Society Fund will support interventions that contribute to: The strengthening of the voice of communities and civil society organisations to influence policy and its implementation, at local national and international levels 2. The prevention of hunger, and the improvement of livelihood security 3. Improved access to essential services, such as education, health care and programmes of HIV prevention, care and support 4. Improved access and control of resources for marginalised communities 5. The promotion and realisation of human rights 6. The promotion of women s empowerment and gender equality, including initiatives to tackle gender based violence 7. The promotion of environmental sustainability and in particular, initiatives that combat climate change.

shortdescription: PEACE-BUILDING FROM BELOW / CONSOLIDATION DE LA PAIX  PARTIR DE LA COMMUNAUT
projecttitle: Peace-Building from Below / Consolidation de la paix  partir de la communaut
purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: The project facilitates the mobilization, development, strengthening, and networking of community-based organizations (CBOs) and people's organizations in two districts in eastern Nepal that lack basic infrastructure, government resources, and social sector support systems. The project focuses on promoting equitable socio-economic development by empowering local people, particularly marginalized and disadvantaged groups. It aims to improve health and sanitation in rural communities by increasing livelihood and employment opportunities for women, Dalits, and other disadvantaged groups. The project includes advocating and networking for social justice, good governance, and pro-poor development. It supports democracy programming by addressing the needs of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and ex-combatants, especially women, who are returning home after years of conflict. The project is implemented by Rural Reconstruction Nepal, in partnership with local CBOs, non-governmental organizations, and relevant government agencies. / Le projet facilite la mobilisation, le dveloppement, le renforcement et le rseautage d'organismes communautaires et d'organismes populaires dans deux districts de l'est du Npal, dont l'infrastructure de base, les ressources gouvernementales et les systmes de soutien du secteur social sont dficients. Le projet vise  favoriser le dveloppement socio-conomique quitable. Il habilite la population locale, notamment les groupes marginaliss et dfavoriss,  amliorer la sant et l'assainissement dans leurs collectivits rurales en augmentant les possibilits de subsistance et d'emploi pour les femmes, les dalits (membres des basses castes) et les autres groupes dfavoriss. Le projet stimule du lobbyisme et du rseautage en faveur de la justice sociale, de la bonne gouvernance et du dveloppement favorable aux pauvres. Il appuie le dveloppement dmocratique en se penchant sur les besoins des personnes dplaces  l'intrieur de leur propre pays (PDIP) et des ex-combattants, surtout des femmes, qui rentrent chez eux aprs des annes de conflit. La mise en oeuvre est assure par Rural Reconstruction Nepal, en partenariat avec des organismes communautaires, organismes locaux non-gouvernementaux et des agences gouvernementales.

Il habilite la population locale, notamment les groupes marginaliss et dfavoriss,  amliorer la sant et l'assainissement dans leurs collectivits rurales en augmentant les possibilits de subsistance et d'emploi pour les femmes, les dalits (membres des basses castes) et les autres groupes dfavoriss. Le projet stimule du lobbyisme et du rseautage en faveur de la justice sociale, de la bonne gouvernance et du dveloppement favorable aux pauvres. Il appuie le dveloppement dmocratique en se penchant sur les besoins des personnes dplaces  l'intrieur de leur propre pays (PDIP) et des ex-combattants, surtout des femmes, qui rentrent chez eux aprs des annes de conflit. La mise en oeuvre est assure par Rural Reconstruction Nepal, en partenariat avec des organismes communautaires, organismes locaux non-gouvernementaux et des agences gouvernementales.

shortdescription: PEACE-BUILDING FROM BELOW / CONSOLIDATION DE LA PAIX  PARTIR DE LA COMMUNAUT
projecttitle: Peace-Building from Below / Consolidation de la paix  partir de la communaut
purposename: Multisector aid for basic soc. serv.
longdescription: The project facilitates the mobilization, development, strengthening, and networking of community-based organizations (CBOs) and people's organizations in two districts in eastern Nepal that lack basic infrastructure, government resources, and social sector support systems. The project focuses on promoting equitable socio-economic development by empowering local people, particularly marginalized and disadvantaged groups. It aims to improve health and sanitation in rural communities by increasing livelihood and employment opportunities for women, Dalits, and other disadvantaged groups. The project includes advocating and networking for social justice, good governance, and pro-poor development. It supports democracy programming by addressing the needs of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and ex-combatants, especially women, who are returning home after years of conflict. The project is implemented by Rural Reconstruction Nepal, in partnership with local CBOs, non-governmental organizations, and relevant government agencies. / Le projet facilite la mobilisation, le dveloppement, le renforcement et le rseautage d'organismes communautaires et d'organismes populaires dans deux districts de l'est du Npal, dont l'infrastructure de base, les ressources gouvernementales et les systmes de soutien du secteur social sont dficients. Le projet vise  favoriser le dveloppement socio-conomique quitable. Il habilite la population locale, notamment les groupes marginaliss et dfavoriss,  amliorer la sant et l'assainissement dans leurs collectivits rurales en augmentant les possibilits de subsistance et d'emploi pour les femmes, les dalits (membres des basses castes) et les autres groupes dfavoriss. Le projet stimule du lobbyisme et du rseautage en faveur de la justice sociale, de la bonne gouvernance et du dveloppement favorable aux pauvres. Il appuie le dveloppement dmocratique en se penchant sur les besoins des personnes dplaces  l'intrieur de leur propre pays (PDIP) et des ex-combattants, surtout des femmes, qui rentrent chez eux aprs des annes de conflit. La mise en oeuvre est assure par Rural Reconstruction Nepal, en partenariat avec des organismes communautaires, organismes locaux non-gouvernementaux et des agences gouvernementales.

shortdescription: MICROENTERPRISE FOR SOUTH-EAST NEPAL / MICROENTREPRISE POUR LE SUD-EST DU NPAL
projecttitle: Microenterprise for South-East Nepal / Microentreprise pour le sud-est du Npal
longdescription: The purpose of this project is to establish a small community-based not-for-profit business led and operated by women, to cultivate, harvest, weave, laminate, and distribute low-cost corrugated bamboo roofing sheets. The roofing sheets are used by the Habitat for Humanity International - Nepal (HFHI-Nepal) Save and Build microfinance housing program for low-income families. The project aims to make housing more affordable for the lowest-income families by reducing the material cost of roofs and ensuring a continuing supply of roofing sheets for HFHI-Nepal. The project also aims to create income-generating opportunities for low-income families involved in each step of the fabrication process.   This is one of two components of a project valued at $493,080. The first component has been completed. / Le but de ce projet est d'tablir une petite entreprise communautaire sans but lucratif dirige et gre par des femmes, pour cultiver, rcolter, tisser, laminer et distribuer un volume important de matriaux de couverture peu coteux, sous forme de feuilles ondules en bambou pour les toitures. Ces feuilles en bambou sont prvues pour le Programme d'pargne et de construction d'habitations microfinances pour les familles  faible revenu d'Habitat pour l'humanit international-Npal (HPHI-Npal). Le projet vise  rendre l'accs  l'hbergement plus abordable pour les familles  faible revenu en rduisant le cot des matriaux pour les toitures et en assurant un approvisionnement durable en feuilles en bambou pour HPHI-Npal. Le projet vise aussi la cration d'occasions de gnration de revenus pour les familles  faible revenu impliques dans toutes les tapes de fabrication.    Il s'agit d'un des deux volets d'un projet d'une valeur totale de 493 080 $. Le premier volet est termin.

Phase IV CCOThe Nepal CCO assists CIDA in implementing its projects efficiently and effectively, providing professional, technical, administrative, and logistical support to CIDA and its programs. This includes development of projects, and implementation, administration, and financilal managmeent of a variety of projects and initiatives. The CCO provides services to CIDA funded activities, including CIDA missions, Canadian Executing Agencies, project monitors, visiting consultants, NGO's in Nepal on CIDA programs and private sector reprentatives supported through CIDA's Industrial Cooperation ProgramThe CCO operates on a cost recovery basis for some activities. In the absence of a dippl;omatic mission in Nepal, the CCO also provides consular services to Foreighn Affairs on a cost recovery basis.The CCO is managed by a locally hired Director, and managed through workplans and regular fiunancial reporting.

shortdescription: SAHAKARYA - BUILDING SELF-RELIANT COMMUNITIES / SAHAKARYA - BTIR DES COLLECTIVITS AUTONOMES
projecttitle: Sahakarya - Building Self-Reliant Communities / Sahakarya - Btir des collectivits autonomes
channelreportedname: CECI Centre d'tude et de coopration
longdescription: Sahakarya aims to improve socio-economic condition of selected communities by promoting equitable and representative community-based organizations (CBOs) capable of managing local resources and interacting with locally elected bodies and government agencies.   The goal of the project is to contribute to the reduction of poverty in the hilly regions of Nepal by strengthening community-based organizations (CBOs) through economic and social development. The project is being implemented in the Mid and Far Western Districts: Jumla, Dadeldhura, Baitadi, Surkhet, and Dailekh, focusing on market-oriented agricultural production. The Canadian Executing Agency is the Centre for Studies and International Cooperation (CECI) and the Social Welfare Council (SWC) is the Nepalese government counterpart. / Sahakarya a pour mission d'amliorer la situation socio-conomique de collectivits choisies en faisant la promotion d'organisations communautaires reprsentatives et quitables aptes  grer les ressources locales et  interagir avec les reprsentants des organes et des organismes gouvernementaux lus localement.   Le projet vise  rduire la pauvret dans les rgions montagneuses du Npal en renforant les organisations communautaires par le dveloppement conomique et social. Le projet est mis en oeuvre dans les districts de l'ouest et de l'extrme ouest du pays, soit Jumla, Dadeldhura, Baitadi, Surkhet et Dailekh, mettant l'accent sur la production agricole axe sur le march. Le centre d'tudes et de coopration internationale est l'agent d'excution canadien et le Conseil du bien-tre social, celui du gouvernement du Npal.

shortdescription: SAHAKARYA - BUILDING SELF-RELIANT COMMUNITIES / SAHAKARYA - BTIR DES COLLECTIVITS AUTONOMES
projecttitle: Sahakarya - Building Self-Reliant Communities / Sahakarya - Btir des collectivits autonomes
channelreportedname: CECI Centre d'tude et de coopration

Nutrition Meeting - Asian participantsFollowing Canada's commitment made at the 2010 MDG Summit, CIDA will host a Nutrition Meeting to coordinate action in the context of the Scaling Up Nutrition (SUN) Framework and Roadmap. High-level representatives from the donor community and asian countries (Bangladesh and Nepal) will discuss how best to collectively support the delivery of proven interventions to the people that need them most.

shortdescription: CANADA FUND FOR LOCAL INITIATIVES (CFLI) - NEPAL - 2011-2012 / FONDS CANADIEN D'INITIATIVES LOCALES (FCIL) - NPAL - 2011-2012
projecttitle: Canada Fund for Local Initiatives (CFLI) - Nepal - 2011-2012 / Fonds canadien d'initiatives locales (FCIL) - Npal - 2011-2012
longdescription: The Canada Fund for Local Initiatives (CFLI) is designed to support small projects proposed and implemented by local organizations in Nepal. In providing funding for small projects that offer direct social, economic, or technical assistance to local populations, the CFLI contributes to the overall goal of reducing poverty.   The objective of this CFLI is to support Nepal's peace process by promoting community reconciliation and enhanced community economic opportunities. It also supports the protection and promotion of human rights. The main organizations eligible for funding are community-based organizations and national level non-governmental organizations. / Le Fonds canadien d'initiatives locales (FCIL) vise  appuyer des petits projets proposs et mis en oeuvre par des organisations locales au Npal. Les projets financs par le FCIL offrent de l'aide (sociale, conomique ou technique) directement a la population locale. Le FCIL contribue ainsi aux objectifs de rduction de la pauvret.   L'objectif de ce FCIL est d'appuyer le processus de la paix au Npal par la promotion de la rconciliation communautaire et l'amlioration des opportunits conomiques dans les collectivits. Le FCIL appuie aussi la protection et promotion des droits humains. Les principales organisations admissibles au financement du FCIL sont les organisations communautaires et les organisations non gouvernementales locales ou nationales.

shortdescription: LOCAL GOVERNANCE AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM / PROGRAMME DE GOUVERNANCE LOCALE ET DE DVELOPPEMENT COMMUNAUTAIRE
projecttitle: Local Governance and Community Development Program / Programme de gouvernance locale et de dveloppement communautaire
purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management
longdescription: The project goal is to contribute to poverty reduction and economic growth through inclusive, responsible and accountable local governance and participatory community-led development. The program purpose is to improve access to locally and inclusively prioritised public goods and services. This is being achieved by investing in rural development, mobilizing local resources and involving communities in local development and planning.   Activities being supported include building roads, irrigation systems and electrification systems which aim to reach all 3,915 villages in Nepal. The Local Governance and Community Development Program (LGCDP) is a national multi-donor program, being implemented by the Government of Nepal's Ministry of Local Development. / Le projet vise  contribuer  la rduction de la pauvret et  la croissance conomique par une gouvernance locale inclusive et responsable, et par le dveloppement men par les communauts. Le but est d'amliorer l'acces aux biens et aux services publics localement et inclusivement prioriss. Ceci est ralis en investissant dans le dveloppement rural, en mobilisant des ressources locales et en impliquant les communauts dans le dveloppement local et la planification.   Les activits comprennent la construction de routes, de systmes d'irrigation et de d'lectrification qui visent  atteindre tous les 3915 villages au Npal. Le Programme de gouvernance locale et de dveloppement communautaire (PGLDC) est un programme national, multidonateurs, mis en oeuvre par le ministre du Dveloppement local du gouvernment du Npal.

shortdescription: SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS THROUGH CO-OPERATIVES / MOYENS DE SUBSISTANCE DURABLES GRCE AUX COOPRATIVES
projecttitle: Sustainable Livelihoods Through Co-operatives / Moyens de subsistance durables grce aux coopratives
longdescription: The program aims to promote the cooperative model to support economic growth and improve food security in communities.   The expected results are: (1) Viable co-operatives provide timely, relevant and gender-sensitive programs and services to members; (2) Government decision-makers are influenced by co-operative sector; (3) Increased social and economic empowerment of women and men; and (4) Effective participation of Canadians in promoting gender equitable sustainable economic and social growth in participating countries.   These results are expected to contribute to strengthening specific areas of expertise, including human resource development, governance training, business planning, marketing training, and technical assistance. / Ce programme vise  faire la promotion du modle coopratif afin d'appuyer la croissance conomique et d'amliorer la scurit alimentaire dans les communauts.   Les rsultats anticips sont : 1) Des coopratives viables fournissent  leurs membres des programmes et des services ponctuels, pertinents, et qui tiennent compte des carts entre les hommes et les femmes ; 2) Les dcideurs du gouvernement sont influencs par le secteur coopratif ; 3) Renforcement de l'autonomie sociale et conomique des femmes et des hommes ; 4) Participation efficace des Canadiens dans la promotion d'une croissance conomique et sociale durable et plus quitable pour les femmes dans les pays viss.   Il est attendu que ces rsultats contribuent au renforcement des secteurs d'expertises spcifiques, y compris le dveloppement des ressources humaines, la formation en gouvernance, la planification des affaires, la formation en marketing, et de l'assistance technique.

shortdescription: SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS THROUGH CO-OPERATIVES / MOYENS DE SUBSISTANCE DURABLES GRCE AUX COOPRATIVES

longdescription: Sahakarya aims to improve socio-economic conditions of selected communities by promoting equitable and representative community-based organizations (CBOs) capable of managing local resources and interacting with locally elected bodies and government agencies.   The goal of the project is to contribute to the reduction of poverty in the hilly regions of Nepal by strengthening community-based organizations (CBOs) through economic and social development. The project is being implemented in the Mid and Far Western Districts: Jumla, Dadeldhura, Baitadi, Surkhet, and Dailekh. The Canadian Executing Agency is Canadian Centre for Studies and International Cooperation (CECI) and the Social Welfare Council (SWC) is the Nepalese government counterpart. / Sahakarya a pour mission d'amliorer la situation socio-conomique de collectivits choisies en faisant la promotion d'organisations communautaires reprsentatives et quitables aptes  grer les ressources locales et  interagir avec les reprsentants des organes et des organismes gouvernementaux lus localement.   Le projet vise  rduire la pauvret dans les rgions montagneuses du Npal en renforant les organisations communautaires par le dveloppement conomique et social. Le projet est mis en oeuvre dans les districts de l'ouest et de l'extrme ouest du pays, soit Jumla, Dadeldhura, Baitadi, Surkhet et Dailekh. Le centre canadien d'tudes et de coopration internationale est l'agent d'excution canadien et le Conseil du bien-tre social, celui du gouvernement du Npal.

shortdescription: WATER, SANITATION AND HYGIENE FOR HEALTH / EAU, ASSAINISSEMENT ET HYGINE POUR LA SANT
projecttitle: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene for Health / Eau, assainissement et hygine pour la sant
channelreportedname: Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation Technology
longdescription: This project aims to contribute to improved maternal and child health by increasing access to improved drinking water, sanitation, and hygiene. The project is establishing eight water expertise and training centres, one in each of the selected countries, to provide training, technical consulting, and educational resources to government agencies, non-governmental organizations and community groups involved in water, sanitation and hygiene services. It is expected that 354,000 people (of which 79% women and children) have access to improved water, sanitation and hygiene. Activities include: community awareness programs on household solutions benefiting maternal, newborn and child health; and institutional capacity development in governance, performance monitoring, strategic and operational planning, and financial sustainability.   The Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation (CAWST) is working in partnership with Seeds of Hope International Partnerships (Zambia); Programme d'appui aux initiatives de dveloppement humain (Haiti), Danish Committee for Aid to Afghan Refugees (Afghanistan), Centre regional pour l'eau potable et l'assainissement (Cameroon), Ethiopian Kale Heywet Church (Ethiopia), Environment and Public Health Organization (Nepal), National Center of Environmental Health and Water Supply    Nam Saat (Laos) and CWS (Cambodia) to implement this project.   This project is part of Canada's Maternal, Newborn and Child Health commitment. The maximum CIDA contribution to this project includes $10,000 for monitoring purposes. / Ce projet vise  amliorer la sant des mres et des enfants en contribuant  augmenter l'accs  une meilleure eau potable, de meilleures installations sanitaires et une meilleure hygine. Huit centres d'expertise et de formation en eau sont tablis, un dans chacun des pays cibls, pour fournir une formation, des conseils techniques et des ressources en ducation aux agences gouvernementales, aux organisations non gouvernementales et aux groupes communautaires impliqus dans les services d'approvisionnement en eau, d'installations sanitaires et d'hygine. Il est attendu que ceci puisse bnficier  354 000 personnes, dont 79 % des femmes et des enfants, afin qu'ils aient accs  des services amliors d'approvisionnement en eau, d'installations sanitaires et d'hygine. Les activits comprennent des programmes de sensibilisation communautaires sur les solutions qui peuvent bnficier la sant des mres, des nouveau-ns et des enfants dans les foyers, et le dveloppement de la capacit institutionnelle en matire de gouvernance, de suivi du rendement, de planification stratgique et oprationnelle, et de viabilit financire.   Le Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation (CAWST) ralise ce projet en partenariat avec la Seeds of Hope International Partnerships (Zambie), le Programme d'appui aux initiatives de dveloppement humain (Hati), le Comit danois d'aide aux rfugis afghans (Afghanistan), le Centre rgional p

shortdescription: WORLD LITERACY OF CANADA - PROGRAM 2007-2011 / WORLD LITERACY OF CANADA - PROGRAMME 2007-2011
projecttitle: World Literacy of Canada - Program 2007-2011 / World Literacy of Canada - Programme 2007-2011
longdescription: The Literacy for Life program works with community partners in South Asia and Canada that emphasize literacy skills and non-formal education for women and children. The program focuses 95% of its efforts on the poorest and most under developed region of the state of Uttar Pradesh in India, 5% in Nepal.   Women are at the core of the Literacy for Life program, and it makes a concerted effort to integrate gender equality in all aspects of operations. Literacy for Life is organized around focus areas such as literacy, health awareness, social enterprise, and women's advocacy groups. / Le programme Alphabtisation pour la vie est ralis avec des partenaires communautaires en Asie du Sud et au Canada qui mettent l'accent sur l'alphabtisation et l'ducation non formelle des femmes et des enfants. Le programme investit 95 % de ses efforts dans les rgions les moins dveloppes de l'tat de l'Uttar Pradesh, en Inde, et 5 % de ses efforts au Npal.   Les femmes sont au coeur du programme Alphabtisation pour la vie, ce qui implique un effort concert afin d'intgrer l'galit entre les sexes dans tous les aspects des diffrentes oprations. Alphabtisation pour la vie est organis autour de domaines cls, tels que l'alphabtisation, la sensibilisation  la sant, l'entreprise sociale et des groupes de dfense des droits des femmes.

shortdescription: HUMAN RIGHTS INTERNET - INTERNATIONAL INTERNSHIPS 2011-2014 / INTERNET DES DROITS HUMAINS - STAGES INTERNATIONAUX 2011-2014
projecttitle: Human Rights Internet - International Internships 2011-2014 / Internet des droits humains - Stages internationaux 2011-2014
longdescription: This project is part of CIDA's International Youth Internship Program (IYIP), funded by Canada's Youth Employment Strategy (YES). It is designed to offer young Canadian post-secondary graduates the opportunity to gain professional experience through international cooperation work. As a general rule, CIDA provides up to $15,000 per internship to Canadian organizations that manage the internships and recruit interns. / Ce projet fait partie du programme de stages internationaux pour les jeunes (PSIJ) de l'ACDI, programme financ par la Stratgie emploi jeunesse (SEJ) du gouvernement du Canada. Le programme offre  des jeunes Canadiennes et Canadiens rcemment diplms (collge ou universit) une exprience professionnelle de travail pratique dans le domaine de la coopration internationale. L'ACDI verse normalement un maximum de 15 000 $ par stage  des organisations canadiennes qui grent les stages et recrutent les stagiaires.

shortdescription: LEAST DEVELOPED COUNTRY FUND FOR ADAPTATION TO CLIMATE CHANGE / FONDS POUR LES PAYS LES MOINS AVANCS CONSACR  L'ADAPTATION AUX CHANGEMENTS CLIMATIQ
projecttitle: Least Developed Country Fund for Adaptation to Climate Change / Fonds pour les pays les moins avancs consacr  l'adaptation aux changements climatiques
longdescription: CIDA's contribution to the Least Developed Countries Fund for Adaptation to Climate Change (LDCF) aims to support least developed countries (LDCs) to increase resilience to the impacts of climate change through both immediate and longer-term adaptation measures in development policies, plans, programs, projects and actions. Amongst other activities, the fund mainly provides support for the preparation of National Adaptation Programmes of Action (NAPAs) and for the implementation of NAPA priorities in LDCs. In the recent revised programming Strategy on Adaptation to Climate Change for 2010-2013, the Fund is now scaling up its programmatic approach to increase the resilience of vulnerable countries in: (i) climate-resilient development, (ii) implementing Adaptation Action, and (iii) estimating costs of Adaptation to Climate Change.   The LDCF is mandated under the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). Operating under the Global Environment Facility (GEF), it addresses the needs of the 49 LDCs that are especially vulnerable to the adverse impacts of climate change. / La contribution de l'ACDI au Fonds pour les pays les moins avancs a pour but d'aider  accroitre la rsilience des pays les moins avancs (PMA) devant les impacts des changements climatiques. Celui-ci appuie ces pays  l'intgrer des mesures d'adaptation immdiates et  long terme dans les politiques, les plans, les programmes, les projets et les activits de dveloppement. Le Fonds finance plusieurs activits, mais principalement la prparation des Programmes d'action nationaux d'adaptation (PANA) et l'application des priorits de ces programmes dans les PMA. Conformment  la rcente stratgie rvise d'adaptation aux changements climatiques pour 2010-2013, le Fonds largit son approche de programmation dans les domaines suivants, afin d'accroitre la rsilience des pays vulnrables : i) le dveloppement rsistant aux conditions climatiques, ii) la mise en oeuvre de l'action pour l'adaptation, et iii) l'estimation des cots de l'adaptation aux changements climatiques.   Le Fonds pour les PMA dcoule de la Convention-cadre des Nations Unies sur les changements climatiques (CCNUCC). Rgi par le Fonds pour l'environnement mondial (FEM), il rpond aux besoins de 49 PMA particulirement vulnrables aux impacts ngatifs des changements climatiques.

In the recent revised programming Strategy on Adaptation to Climate Change for 2010-2013, the Fund is now scaling up its programmatic approach to increase the resilience of vulnerable countries in: (i) climate-resilient development, (ii) implementing Adaptation Action, and (iii) estimating costs of Adaptation to Climate Change.   The LDCF is mandated under the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). Operating under the Global Environment Facility (GEF), it addresses the needs of the 49 LDCs that are especially vulnerable to the adverse impacts of climate change. / La contribution de l'ACDI au Fonds pour les pays les moins avancs a pour but d'aider  accroitre la rsilience des pays les moins avancs (PMA) devant les impacts des changements climatiques. Celui-ci appuie ces pays  l'intgrer des mesures d'adaptation immdiates et  long terme dans les politiques, les plans, les programmes, les projets et les activits de dveloppement. Le Fonds finance plusieurs activits, mais principalement la prparation des Programmes d'action nationaux d'adaptation (PANA) et l'application des priorits de ces programmes dans les PMA. Conformment  la rcente stratgie rvise d'adaptation aux changements climatiques pour 2010-2013, le Fonds largit son approche de programmation dans les domaines suivants, afin d'accroitre la rsilience des pays vulnrables : i) le dveloppement rsistant aux conditions climatiques, ii) la mise en oeuvre de l'action pour l'adaptation, et iii) l'estimation des cots de l'adaptation aux changements climatiques.   Le Fonds pour les PMA dcoule de la Convention-cadre des Nations Unies sur les changements climatiques (CCNUCC). Rgi par le Fonds pour l'environnement mondial (FEM), il rpond aux besoins de 49 PMA particulirement vulnrables aux impacts ngatifs des changements climatiques.

shortdescription: WATER, SANITATION AND SMOKELESS STOVES IN RAMECHHAP / EAU, ASSAINISSEMENT ET POLES SANS FUME AU RAMECHHAP
projecttitle: Water, Sanitation and Smokeless Stoves in Ramechhap / Eau, assainissement et poles sans fume au Ramechhap
longdescription: The project aims to improve the livelihoods of poor rural populations of Ramechhap District by providing water, sanitation services, and low-smoke cooking technologies. World Neighbours Canada and its local partner, Tamakoshi Sewa Samiti, provide families with gravity-flow water systems to deliver clean water year-round through public tap stands, domestic toilets, and smokeless domestic cooking stoves to reduce in-house smoke emission and overall fuel consumption. The project applies an approach that makes effective use of local resources and includes community involvement as a key element. The project provides materials and technical support for the project components' implementation. It includes local contribution of materials, such as sand and gravel, and labour, to build effective low cost water, sanitation and cooking facilities. / Le projet vise  amliorer les moyens de subsistance des population rurales pauvres du district de Ramechhap en fournissant de l'eau, des services sanitaires, et des technologies de cuisson  faible gnration de fume. World Neighbours Canada et son partenaire local Tamakoshi Sewa Samiti fournissent aux familles des dispositifs d'alimentation en eau par gravit pour assurer l'approvisionnement d'eau propre  l'anne longue dans des stations publiques de robinets, pour les toilettes domestiques, ainsi que des fourneaux de cuisson domestique sans fume afin de rduire les missions de fume dans les maisons et rduire la consommation de combustible. Le projet favorise l'utilisation efficace des ressources locales et mise sur la participation de la collectivit. Le projet fournit le matriel et le soutien technique pour la mise en oeuvre du projet. Ceci inclut la contribution locale de matriaux comme le sable et la gravelle ainsi que la main-d'oeuvre pour construire des installations efficaces et abordables d'approvisionnement en eau, de services sanitaires et de cuisson.

shortdescription: SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS THROUGH CO-OPERATIVES / MOYENS DE SUBSISTANCE DURABLES GRCE AUX COOPRATIVES
projecttitle: Sustainable Livelihoods Through Co-operatives / Moyens de subsistance durables grce aux coopratives
longdescription: The program aims to promote the cooperative model to support economic growth and improve food security in communities.   The expected results are: (1) Viable co-operatives provide timely, relevant and gender-sensitive programs and services to members; (2) Government decision-makers are influenced by co-operative sector; (3) Increased social and economic empowerment of women and men; and (4) Effective participation of Canadians in promoting gender equitable sustainable economic and social growth in participating countries.   These results are expected to contribute to strengthening specific areas of expertise, including human resource development, governance training, business planning, marketing training, and technical assistance. / Ce programme vise  faire la promotion du modle coopratif afin d'appuyer la croissance conomique et d'amliorer la scurit alimentaire dans les communauts.   Les rsultats anticips sont : 1) Des coopratives viables fournissent  leurs membres des programmes et des services ponctuels, pertinents, et qui tiennent compte des carts entre les hommes et les femmes ; 2) Les dcideurs du gouvernement sont influencs par le secteur coopratif ; 3) Renforcement de l'autonomie sociale et conomique des femmes et des hommes ; 4) Participation efficace des Canadiens dans la promotion d'une croissance conomique et sociale durable et plus quitable pour les femmes dans les pays viss.   Il est attendu que ces rsultats contribuent au renforcement des secteurs d'expertises spcifiques, y compris le dveloppement des ressources humaines, la formation en gouvernance, la planification des affaires, la formation en marketing, et de l'assistance technique.

shortdescription: CANADA FUND FOR LOCAL INITIATIVES (CFLI) - NEPAL - 2011-2012 / FONDS CANADIEN D'INITIATIVES LOCALES (FCIL) - NPAL - 2011-2012
projecttitle: Canada Fund for Local Initiatives (CFLI) - Nepal - 2011-2012 / Fonds canadien d'initiatives locales (FCIL) - Npal - 2011-2012
longdescription: The Canada Fund for Local Initiatives (CFLI) is designed to support small projects proposed and implemented by local organizations in Nepal. In providing funding for small projects that offer direct social, economic, or technical assistance to local populations, the CFLI contributes to the overall goal of reducing poverty.   The objective of this CFLI is to support Nepal's peace process by promoting community reconciliation and enhanced community economic opportunities. It also supports the protection and promotion of human rights. The main organizations eligible for funding are community-based organizations and national level non-governmental organizations. / Le Fonds canadien d'initiatives locales (FCIL) vise  appuyer des petits projets proposs et mis en oeuvre par des organisations locales au Npal. Les projets financs par le FCIL offrent de l'aide (sociale, conomique ou technique) directement a la population locale. Le FCIL contribue ainsi aux objectifs de rduction de la pauvret.   L'objectif de ce FCIL est d'appuyer le processus de la paix au Npal par la promotion de la rconciliation communautaire et l'amlioration des opportunits conomiques dans les collectivits. Le FCIL appuie aussi la protection et promotion des droits humains. Les principales organisations admissibles au financement du FCIL sont les organisations communautaires et les organisations non gouvernementales locales ou nationales.

shortdescription: SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS THROUGH CO-OPERATIVES / MOYENS DE SUBSISTANCE DURABLES GRCE AUX COOPRATIVES
projecttitle: Sustainable Livelihoods Through Co-operatives / Moyens de subsistance durables grce aux coopratives
longdescription: The program aims to promote the cooperative model to support economic growth and improve food security in communities.   The expected results are: (1) Viable co-operatives provide timely, relevant and gender-sensitive programs and services to members; (2) Government decision-makers are influenced by co-operative sector; (3) Increased social and economic empowerment of women and men; and (4) Effective participation of Canadians in promoting gender equitable sustainable economic and social growth in participating countries.   These results are expected to contribute to strengthening specific areas of expertise, including human resource development, governance training, business planning, marketing training, and technical assistance. / Ce programme vise  faire la promotion du modle coopratif afin d'appuyer la croissance conomique et d'amliorer la scurit alimentaire dans les communauts.   Les rsultats anticips sont : 1) Des coopratives viables fournissent  leurs membres des programmes et des services ponctuels, pertinents, et qui tiennent compte des carts entre les hommes et les femmes ; 2) Les dcideurs du gouvernement sont influencs par le secteur coopratif ; 3) Renforcement de l'autonomie sociale et conomique des femmes et des hommes ; 4) Participation efficace des Canadiens dans la promotion d'une croissance conomique et sociale durable et plus quitable pour les femmes dans les pays viss.   Il est attendu que ces rsultats contribuent au renforcement des secteurs d'expertises spcifiques, y compris le dveloppement des ressources humaines, la formation en gouvernance, la planification des affaires, la formation en marketing, et de l'assistance technique.

shortdescription: HUMAN RIGHTS AND CAPACITY BUILDING IN NEPAL / DROITS DE LA PERSONNE ET RENFORCEMENT DES CAPACITS AU NPAL
projecttitle: Human Rights and Capacity Building in Nepal / Droits de la personne et renforcement des capacits au Npal
purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
channelname: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (extrabudgetary contributions only)
channelreportedname: OHCHR - Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights
longdescription: The project contributes to the efforts of the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) to fulfil its mandate provided through the Nepal Comprehensive Peace Agreement signed November 21, 2006. While its prime mandate is the promotion and protection of the human rights, monitoring and reporting on human rights abuses, past and present, and presenting recommendations to the Nepalese government, OHCHR also provides resources and support to strengthen the capacity of Nepalese institutions to effectively carry on a human rights program during its mission and after its departure. The OHCHR, with its 170 staff and five regional offices, has the capacity to closely monitor abuses and seek to influence government relating to the preparation of human rights cases and legislation, as part of its 2008/09 program. / Ce projet vise  aider le Haut Commissariat des Nations Unies aux droits de l'homme (HCDH-ONU)  remplir le mandat qui lui a t confi  la suite de l'accord de paix global au Npal, qui a t sign le 21 novembre 2006. Le HCDH doit avant tout dfendre et protger les droits de la personne, assurer le suivi des violations des droits de la personne passes et prsentes et en faire rapport et faire des recommandations au gouvernement npalais. Cependant, le HCDH doit aussi donner aux institutions npalaises les moyens, sous forme de ressources et de soutien, de poursuivre un programme efficace de dfense des droits de la personne, pendant la dure de sa mission et aprs. Le HCDH, avec ses 170 employs et ses 5 bureaux rgionaux, est  mme de suivre de trs prs les violations des droits de la personne et de tenter d'user de son influence sur le gouvernement pour qu'il prpare des dossiers et des textes lgislatifs relatifs aux droits de la personne; dans le cadre de son programme 2008-2009.

shortdescription: SUPPORT TO THE FOREST CARBON PARTNERSHIP FACILITY'S READINESS FUND / APPUI AU FONDS DE PRPARATION DU FONDS DE PARTENARIAT POUR LE CARBONE FORESTIER
projecttitle: Support to the Forest Carbon Partnership Facility's Readiness Fund / Appui au Fonds de prparation du Fonds de partenariat pour le carbone forestier
longdescription: This project supports the Readiness Fund of the Forest Carbon Partnership Facility (FCPF), which is a World Bank-managed facility that assists developing countries in their efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from deforestation and forest degradation. It also promotes conservation, sustainable management of forests and enhancement of forest carbon stocks. The FCPF has the dual objective of building capacity in developing countries in tropical and subtropical regions (Readiness Fund), and testing a program of performance-based incentive payments in selected pilot countries on a relatively small scale (Carbon Fund). CIDA's contribution to the FCPF Readiness Fund supports national capacity building to address the problem of deforestation and forest degradation, by providing technical and financial assistance to countries in the development of their strategies. / Ce projet appuie le Fonds de prparation du Fonds de partenariat pour le carbone forestier (FCPF), une infrastructure dirige par la Banque mondiale qui a pour but de soutenir les efforts dploys par les pays en dveloppement pour rduire les missions de gaz  effet de serre produites par le dboisement et le dprissement de la fort. Il appuie galement la conservation et la gestion durable des forts ainsi que l'amlioration des rserves de carbone forestier. Le FCPF vise non seulement  btir les capacits des pays en dveloppement des rgions tropicales et subtropicales (Fonds de prparation), mais aussi  mettre  l'essai,  une chelle relativement petite, un programme d'incitatifs financiers axs sur le rendement dans certains pays slectionns (Fonds pour le carbone). La contribution de l'Agence canadienne de dveloppement international au Fonds de prparation du FCPF soutient le renforcement des capacits nationales qui ont pour but de remdier au problme du dboisement et du dprissement de la fort. Cette contribution sous forme d'aide technique et financire soutient les pays en dveloppement dans le cadre de l'laboration de leurs stratgies.

shortdescription: SEVA CANADA SOCIETY PROGRAM 2011-2016 / PROGRAMME SEVA CANADA SOCIETY 2011-2016
projecttitle: Seva Canada Society Program 2011-2016 / Programme Seva Canada Society 2011-2016
longdescription: The primary focus of Seva's program is to strengthen community ophthalmology, especially the identification and treatment of people needing cataract surgery. Program components include strengthening institutional training, research, knowledge transfer and monitoring capabilities, reducing gender inequalities in access to eye care and meeting the specific needs of children. Public engagement activities in Canada regarding blindness issues are a component of this program. / Le programme de Seva se concentre principalement sur le renforcement des services ophtalmologiques communautaires, en particulier dans l'indentification et le traitement de personnes qui ont besoin de chirurgie pour les cataractes. Les lments du programme comprennent le renforcement de la formation institutionnelle, la recherche, le transfert des connaissances et le suivi des capacits, tout en rduisant l'ingalit d'accs aux soins des yeux pour les hommes et les femmes et en rpondant aux besoins particuliers des enfants. Des activits d'engagement du public au Canada en ce qui a trait aux enjeux lis  la ccit font galement partie de ce programme.

shortdescription: WATER, SANITATION AND HYGIENE FOR HEALTH / EAU, ASSAINISSEMENT ET HYGINE POUR LA SANT
projecttitle: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene for Health / Eau, assainissement et hygine pour la sant
channelreportedname: Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation Technology
longdescription: This project aims to contribute to improved maternal and child health by increasing access to improved drinking water, sanitation, and hygiene. The project is establishing eight water expertise and training centres, one in each of the selected countries, to provide training, technical consulting, and educational resources to government agencies, non-governmental organizations and community groups involved in water, sanitation and hygiene services. It is expected that 354,000 people (of which 79% women and children) have access to improved water, sanitation and hygiene. Activities include: community awareness programs on household solutions benefiting maternal, newborn and child health; and institutional capacity development in governance, performance monitoring, strategic and operational planning, and financial sustainability.   The Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation (CAWST) is working in partnership with Seeds of Hope International Partnerships (Zambia); Programme d'appui aux initiatives de dveloppement humain (Haiti), Danish Committee for Aid to Afghan Refugees (Afghanistan), Centre regional pour l'eau potable et l'assainissement (Cameroon), Ethiopian Kale Heywet Church (Ethiopia), Environment and Public Health Organization (Nepal), National Center of Environmental Health and Water Supply    Nam Saat (Laos) and CWS (Cambodia) to implement this project.   This project is part of Canada's Maternal, Newborn and Child Health commitment. The maximum CIDA contribution to this project includes $10,000 for monitoring purposes. / Ce projet vise  amliorer la sant des mres et des enfants en contribuant  augmenter l'accs  une meilleure eau potable, de meilleures installations sanitaires et une meilleure hygine. Huit centres d'expertise et de formation en eau sont tablis, un dans chacun des pays cibls, pour fournir une formation, des conseils techniques et des ressources en ducation aux agences gouvernementales, aux organisations non gouvernementales et aux groupes communautaires impliqus dans les services d'approvisionnement en eau, d'installations sanitaires et d'hygine. Il est attendu que ceci puisse bnficier  354 000 personnes, dont 79 % des femmes et des enfants, afin qu'ils aient accs  des services amliors d'approvisionnement en eau, d'installations sanitaires et d'hygine. Les activits comprennent des programmes de sensibilisation communautaires sur les solutions qui peuvent bnficier la sant des mres, des nouveau-ns et des enfants dans les foyers, et le dveloppement de la capacit institutionnelle en matire de gouvernance, de suivi du rendement, de planification stratgique et oprationnelle, et de viabilit financire.   Le Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation (CAWST) ralise ce projet en partenariat avec la Seeds of Hope International Partnerships (Zambie), le Programme d'appui aux initiatives de dveloppement humain (Hati), le Comit danois d'aide aux rfugis afghans (Afghanistan), le Centre rgional p

shortdescription: WUSC-CECI (UNITERRA) - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (UNITERRA) - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2014
projecttitle: WUSC-CECI (Uniterra) - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (Uniterra) - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
longdescription: The Uniterra international voluntary program aims to contribute to poverty reduction and sustainable development through national and regional sectoral approaches in 13 developing countries with the support of 1,950 volunteers. The Uniterra program focuses on strengthening the capacity of 225 key organizations that work in private sector development, governance, health, and education. More specifically, the program focuses on improving access to health and education services, markets, and political participation; fostering equality between women and men; engaging organizations in political dialogue in specific sectoral issues; and raising awareness among Canadians of national, regional, and global issues with regards to private sector development, governance, health, education, and equality between women and men.   The Uniterra program is jointly operated by the Centre for International Studies and Cooperation (CECI) and World University Services of Canada (WUSC). / Le programme de volontariat international Uniterra vise  contribuer par des approches sectorielles nationales et rgionales  la rduction de la pauvret et au dveloppement durable dans 13 pays en dveloppement avec l'appui de 1 950 volontaires. Le programme Uniterra est ax sur le renforcement des capacits de 225 organisations cls du secteur priv, de la gouvernance, de la sant et de l'ducation. Plus particulirement, il vise  : amliorer l'accs aux services de sant et d'ducaion, aux marchs et  la participation politique; favoriser l'galit entre les femmes et les hommes; engager les organisations dans le dialogue sur les politiques en lien avec les enjeux de leur secteur; sensibiliser les Canadiens et les Canadiennes aux enjeux nationaux, rgionaux et mondiaux autour du secteur priv, de la gouvernance, de la sant, de l'ducation et de l'galit entre les femmes et les hommes.   Le programme Uniterra est mis en oeuvre conjointement par le Centre d'tude et de coopration internationale (CECI) et Entraide universitaire mondiale du Canada (EUMC).

Le programme Uniterra est ax sur le renforcement des capacits de 225 organisations cls du secteur priv, de la gouvernance, de la sant et de l'ducation. Plus particulirement, il vise  : amliorer l'accs aux services de sant et d'ducaion, aux marchs et  la participation politique; favoriser l'galit entre les femmes et les hommes; engager les organisations dans le dialogue sur les politiques en lien avec les enjeux de leur secteur; sensibiliser les Canadiens et les Canadiennes aux enjeux nationaux, rgionaux et mondiaux autour du secteur priv, de la gouvernance, de la sant, de l'ducation et de l'galit entre les femmes et les hommes.   Le programme Uniterra est mis en oeuvre conjointement par le Centre d'tude et de coopration internationale (CECI) et Entraide universitaire mondiale du Canada (EUMC).

shortdescription: KABHRE RURAL DEVELOPMENT / DVELOPPEMENT RURAL  KABHRE
projecttitle: Kabhre Rural Development / Dveloppement rural  Kabhre
longdescription: The objective of this project is to improve hygiene and sanitation in 42 villages of Kabhre Palanchok District in Nepal, benefitting 8,300 community members. The project assists community members with the construction of 922 permanent latrines and provides environmental, sanitation, and gender awareness sessions for the community members. The latrines are designed to produce biogas for cooking (used instead of firewood), and beneficiaries are encouraged to link their latrine to a biogas plant. In addition, project management training is provided to members of village project committees, to enable them to oversee the project.   This is one of two parts of a project valued at $252,000. / Le but de ce projet est d'amliorer les installations sanitaires et l'hygine de 42 villages du district de Kabhre Palanchok au Npal. Le projet aide les quelques 8 300 membres de la collectivit  construire 922 latrines permanentes,  fournir des installations sanitaires qui respectent l'environnement et  sensibiliser la population par l'entremise de sessions d'information sur l'galit entre les femmes et les hommes. Les latrines sont conues pour rcuprer les biogaz pour faire la cuisine (au lieu d'utiliser du bois de chauffage) et les bnficiaires sont encourags  connecter leurs latrines  une usine de transformation de biogaz. De plus, une formation en gestion de projet est donne aux membres des comits des villages afin de leur permettre de prendre en charge le projet.   Il s'agit d'une des deux parties d'un projet d'une valeur totale de 252 000 $.

shortdescription: USC CANADA - PROGRAM 2010-2015 / USC CANADA - PROGRAMME 2010-2015
projecttitle: USC Canada - Program 2010-2015 / USC Canada - Programme 2010-2015
longdescription: This program contributes to enhanced food security by: (1) significantly increasing the production of food for 15,000 households; (2) stimulating sustainable economic growth by promoting community economic activities for 7,000 households; and (3) increasing household income by an estimated 20%.   Key activities include: (1) training partner staff in monitoring and conducting baseline studies and assessments; (2) strengthening the capacity of community seed banks by creating additional seed banks, providing training in plant breeding, and control of post-harvest losses; (3) improving agricultural infrastructure for soil and water conservation, providing training on cropping methodologies and promoting agroforestry; (4) training farmers in post-harvest processing, providing training on micro-enterprises and strengthening the capacity of farmers' and women's associations; (5) undertaking gender analyses and gender audits with all USC partners to provide them with leadership training and to promote women-led agricultural production and income-generating activities for women; and (6) engaging Canadians by hosting several hundred community events across Canada, developing short videos, and producing publications related to food security. / Ce programme contribue  rehausser la scurit alimentaire : 1) en augmentant substantiellement la production d'aliments pour 15 000 foyers; 2) en stimulant une croissance conomique durable par la promotion d'activits conomiques communautaires pour 7 000 foyers; 3) en augmentant le revenu des familles d'environ 20 %.   Parmi les activits principales : 1) former le personnel du partenaire en matire de suivi et de ralisation d'tudes et d'valuations de base; 2) renforcer la capacit communautaire en matire de banques de semences en crant des banques de semences additionnelles, en fournissant une formation sur la reproduction des plantes et sur le contrle des pertes aprs les rcoltes; 3) amliorer les infrastructures agricoles en matire de conservation des sols et de l'eau en fournissant une formation sur les mthodes de culture sur terrains dfrichs et en favorisant l'agroforesterie; 4) former les fermiers en matire de procds de distribution suite aux rcoltes en fournissant une formation en micro-entreprises et en renforant la capacit des fermiers et des associations de femmes; 5) raliser des analyses et des rapports sur l'galit des sexes avec tous les partenaires de l'USC pour leur donner une formation en leadership et favoriser une production agricole mene par les femmes et des activits gnratrices de revenus pour les femmes; 6) mobiliser les Canadiens en organisant plusieurs centaines d'vnements communautaires  travers le Canada, par la prsentation de courts vidos et la distribution de dpliants sur la scurit alimentaire.
